God of WisdomAnswered on 29 Jan 2019After setting aside 6 months of your income as an emergency expense, I would recommend 2 methods to look at your asset allocation.1) Have your age as the % of your portfolio in bonds. So if you're 25, you should have a 75% Equity, 25% Bond Portfolio. You can easily set this up with an FA or a Robo advisory. Adjust every 5-10 years. Rebalance quarterly.2) Expected Rate Of Return. This method is for when you die die need the money to be used.Years to Requirement  รท 3 or 4 depending on your risk profile.E.g. If you need the money in 30 years for retirement for example. Your portfolio should be giving you 7.5%-10% in returns per annum. Thus, more equity heavy, try some alternative investments. But if you die die need the money in 10 years, then I would suggest only looking for 2.5-3.3% returns. Thus a bond heavy portfolio or endowment plans.0 comments0
